intro: Lindernia boutiqueana, commonly known as the miniature lindernia, is a compact, flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 centimeters, making it ideal for rock gardens or containers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Lindernia boutiqueana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
